alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing only metal atoms of at least two different types, where the heaviest atom is a post-transition metal.
alternative_parents.name: Intermetallic post-transition metal compounds

alternative_parents.description: Inorganic compounds containing a nickel atom.
alternative_parents.name: Inorganic nickel compounds

description: This compound belongs to the class of inorganic compounds known as inorganic salts. These are inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.

direct_parent.description: Inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
direct_parent.name: Inorganic salts

kingdom.description: Compounds that do not contain a C atom. Exceptions are made for isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon trioxide, carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Inorganic compounds

superclass.description: Inorganic compounds consisting of an assembly of cations and anions.
superclass.name: Inorganic salts
